lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone! And welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role One-Shots, where we have taken over the slot of "No Survivors" this Monday thanks to the illustrious generosity of the fantastic Ivan Van Norman.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Any day, you may take the slot whenever you wish, especially when I get to be a player.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, super excited to back that. Before we get started, let me go ahead and introduce our fantastic players for this evening. We have on the table to my left, we have Ivan, who you've already seen thus far, Ivan Van Norman, hello. Thank you for joining us.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I am happy to be here. Thank you for having me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yay! We have Marisha Ray from Critical Role.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hi, guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And to the other table, we have Taliesin Jaffe from Critical Role.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hi!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And our very two special guests joining us this evening, Ashly Burch--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hello!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Phil Lamarr!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which, to let you guys know, tonight's game is going to be interesting because unlike a lot of other fantasy RPGs, tonight the whole party is goblins. Everyone are playing goblins, we'll go ahead and do some quick introductions as to who you're playing, starting clockwise back from how we were introduced. So, Phil, who are you playing as?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I'm playing as Browntooth the rogue. Goblin rogue. Sort of redundant. But it's a very large word that I learned. Redundant.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: And someone clearly cast Bull's Strength on those testicles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ashly, who are you playing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm Piglet the barbarian.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Delightful. Taliesin?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm Mezek the monk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Aw, this is going to be fun. Marisha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm Snizzler, the mad bombing alchemist!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, man. I'm already excited. And Ivan.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Goblin fartmage, available to all of you. I am the brains of the bunch, as you can see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect! This will be a fun adventure for the evening.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You actually get to use the phrase, "I've smelt it, now it's time that I dealt it."

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Stolen, it will be used.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, take it. Public domain, public domain. I'm sorry if I already stepped on that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we've got to go through a couple quick announcements here and then we'll overview the game stuff. So for those watching, I want to remind you that this Thursday is Critical Role's 50th episode. We're having a special episode to commemorate this, a couple of surprises that we have in store for you guys, so definitely be there at Thursday at 7:00pm Pacific to check out our 50th episode. Marisha, you have a new episode of Signal Boost tomorrow--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes! Episode two of Hector! Which is episode six of Signal Boost! Watch it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And having already seen it, this episode has my favorite intro so far. I laughed for five solid minutes straight, so you'll enjoy it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's very funny. Check it out, it's very funny. Hector's funny.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Hector's the best.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is happening on April 30th, we'll be doing a whole series of great events here in the studio throughout the day so mark it on your calendars, get your friends together--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: 24 hours of livestreaming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes! It's going to be great. It's going to be great.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: For charity, right? For a good cause?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: KaBOOM! kaboom.org, which is bringing play back into the lives of children currently living in property, (scoffs) "in property." In poverty!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Children who have been bricked into walls! It's horrible!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: They're stuck on estates! With nothing but ponies. They need to play!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: They're living amongst property, land is surrounding them. No, guys, so currently kids living in poverty and they're trying to bring play back into their lives, such as things like board games, and we're actually going to be giving away a lot of board games to kaboom.org, part of your involvement during International Tabletop Day, so don't miss it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And if you'd like to plug what usually occupies this spot on Mondays...?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Oh, well, if you're a Critical Role fan, or if you're any kind of fan, and normally you're here Monday nights, then thank you for coming on Monday night again. If you're not, and this a weird timeslot for you, we still play role-playing games on Monday nights, they are just mini-campaigns instead of the epic, long brainchild of Matt Mercer's amazing imagination, instead we do little one-offs, like we just got done playing "Army of Darkness" which was then created by chat, it was coined "The Arby's of Darkness," because their last stand was in the middle of an Arby's restaurant which one of the characters managed. And officially--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's amazing

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: It was pretty cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What meat is this? What meat is this?!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: The deadites actually came out through the portal at the very end of it, and they were all the busboys, and the, "I'll swallow your soul, I'll swallow your soul!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's every Arby's I've ever been to.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Really, it's the same thing.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: And the next campaign that we're going to be doing officially/unofficially, is going to be "Pugmire," which is a new game, it's basically 5th edition in a world of fantasy dogs. It's a post-apocalyptic future--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to make a joke about that, and then it was the real thing, so--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: It exists. It's in the future, in which all man has been wiped out and now dogs reign supreme, and they have formed a church called, "The Church of Man," in which they have a code of laws, the first law being, "Be a good dog." The second law being, "Fetch what has been left behind," and the third being, I believe it's, "Bite only those who attack you." So it's great--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm imagining Mad Max with dogs, in my mind now.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So you could be like, a pincer cleric, or you could be a dachshund rogue or something like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's fantastic.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So 7:00-10:00pm usually on Mondays, come hang out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do it. Check it out, guys. It's pretty fantastic. So, another cool thing about having Paizo, the folks from Pathfinder here, is we have a bunch of giveaways to give out throughout the evening to all you guys in chat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like, there's a bag of stuff. I don't even know what it is. It's exciting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's edamame.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, big old grand prize for one of you guys out there, so make sure you're engaging.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway. Now that that's over with--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Woo! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For tonight's game, you guys will be playing goblins, of course. I'll go over the story here in a moment, but things to consider: part of tonight's fun is, at certain points during the story, if you roll really crappily on a roll, or you want to get that extra action in, you're doing good and you want to get that extra attack or extra ability, each of you have constructed and have at your disposal a goblin song that is custom to your character. You may choose to sing this song out loud on the stream and doing so will gain use of that reroll or that extra action. Use it sparingly, it's only once in a while, possibly a once-a-night type circumstance. But I'm exci-- (burps) pardon, I'm excited to hear all of your individual songs as we progress.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So excited, it gave him indigestion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's how it's the reaction, I get nervous, guys. Great. So, that being the case, let's go ahead and get this show on the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god, I'm so excited.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: There we go. Goblin pants!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Liam, I'm touching your stuff, I'm touching your stuff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to rub my butt on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Here in the Sandpoint Hinterlands, nestled in the western side of the Devil's Platter Mountain Range, there lies the Bird-Cruncher Tribe of rather rambunctious goblins known for their deft trapping skills, having earned their name and the majority of their food supply by snaring wild birds and eating them raw. You five have grown up together here among the caves and cliffs over the past six years, outliving many of your other brethren, making you tough. Although most of you were the runts, discarded as weak and useless, you were all taken in and raised within your cages, which is how most goblins are raised, by the sagely Guffeye.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Guffeye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An ancient goblin oracle of nearly 30 years of age, who enjoyed the idea of having her own troop of personal guardians, she shouts that she is touched by the sight of Zogmugot, Lady Last-Breath and the goblin hero-god of flotsam and scavenging, though many of her visions have led to grave misfortune and her favor within the tribe has waned. But you guys believe her! Mostly.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Zogmugot looks favorably upon our lovely Guffeye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This cold, overcast autumn morning rolls in, and the five of you are returning from a morning snare run, when you hear the sound of crackling shouts from old Guffeye's crag porch. "Come! Come! "The dream! The sight! Come!" And she darts back into her little cave hole.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Guffeye has another dream! You know what that means!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Someone's going to lose a hand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Usually this means she's been drinking, I just want to point that out.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Well, let's go see what the old windbag's up to, because you know it's going to involve us probably dying.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Entering her home, the familiar smell of pungent spices and rotting wood hits your nose, and this hoarder hole of a home is crammed to the brim with driftwood, molded leather, metal scraps, torn hides, broken pottery, all sorts of other beautiful pieces of junk.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: It's amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nostalgia comes over you as you glance at the empty iron cages you once grew up in, now partially buried and filled with wet wool. As you guys enter, old Guffeye steps onto a small box and turns, her snow-blind eyes clouded and bulging above her toothy grin: "My runts! The Lady gifts "Guffeye. The wait is broken! I have a vision once more. A thing, a great thing was shown to Guffeye, "in both these eyes: a stone of crack and thoom! A rock that barks like the storm! This rock, this "stone, Guffeye must have! This Guffeye must get! You! You must get this stone, bring it to me, for "the Lady's blessing."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Guffeye, if I give it to you first will you like me the best?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I already like you the best--"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "--but I will like you twice best."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh my God.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Guffeye, as your esteemed and most intellectual advisor, I have to ask: where did the Lady bestow this vision upon you that we may find the barking rock?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I awoke this morning, envisioning just how much more I like Piglet than the rest of you--"

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: But I just got done scrubbing all of your sores last night!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Silence!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, Guffeye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "His name was Zaan-- Hold on."

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Zaan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Zaan-- Zantos."

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Zantos!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Guffeye saw the people around the churchman at this festival-- the churchman has the storm "rock on him!"

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Ooh, storm rock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So. Go to this Sandpoint. Go to this human festival. Find this blue-skinned, blue-robed "church-man and take the stone for Guffeye, yes?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That sounds pretty easy, like nothing bad will happen?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Easy! Exactly! We got this!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Lady also showed me: other goblins know."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Stupid, stupid Seven-Tooth tribe also wants stone, going to city now!"

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Why would the Lady show them the blue stone?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Four tooth too many, that's--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Seven tooth too much, two tooth is best tooth!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree, I agree.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Two tooth is best tooth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You go. Sneak in! Find churchman! Take storm rock before Seven-Tooth dumb-dumbs! Bring "back to Guffeye, get blessing-- and good meal, promise."

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Oh, well, if there's food--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And drink.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! Only with a good meal and a drink! You got it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This I can provide."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And dessert?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Piglet, you're now second most favorite."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (wailing) No! I didn't mean it! I don't want dessert!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Greed diminishes you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (crying)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bring me stone, become first favorite!"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now go! Time is wasting!"

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: (singing) Blue stone, blue stone, we will get it all! Blue stone, blue stone, then we'll eat them all! Stupid Seven-tooth is going to burn and burn and die! Burn them all, burn burn, burn and burn and die. Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) As you guys exit the cavern, you go to your various hidey-holes, gather all your materials, your weaponry, whatever things you think you may require on this journey. You know that the direction is northwest, past the Ravenroost mountain pass, towards this town of Sandpoint, and that is where your path lies. The clouds begin to gather overhead at this point in time.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Ooh. Best weather for scavenging!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Nice and clammy.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: They won't even see us coming! Because we're goblins.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A gentle rain slowly begins to hit down from the sky above.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: How long is it going to take for us to get to Sandpoint?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Depends on who's the best leader to find their way there. I guess--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Grizznak is best leader!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I am best leader!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Grizznak is smarter!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Which way do your feet point?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whoever said you were the smartest?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Because I am the wizard, and the wizard is always the smartest! This is simple goblin logic!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That is pretty good logic. I agree with that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But I have a big hammer!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: But you are-- look--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She does have a big hammer, she has a very fair point.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Guffeye already tells you that you are the most elite of Guffeye. So we don't want to soil poor Piglet into having you out at front, best to let Snizzler and Grizznak lead the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're the most complete, you heard him, that's absolutely true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree with that, yeah. You don't want to tarnish your beautiful, shining reputation.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're right. She would be so sad if I died.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tarnish the, tarnish the handle of the-- yeah, it's--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, that's true. She wouldn't care if you guys died, but if I died she'd probably be sad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Exactly, exactly!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Besides, whoever is in front is most likely to be shot in the face with something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, so, naturally, we're better to lead. Am I right, Grizz?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yeah, you got it Snizzler. Grizz'n'Snizz, all the way!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grizz'n'Snizz!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So I'm assuming I'm going to make some navigation--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would like for you to make a survival check, as the leader of his group.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Haha, yes, leader!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grizz or Snizz?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, whoever one is leading.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, he's leading.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm clearly the most intelligent goblin in this troupe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh boy, you're so smart.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I smell mutiny already?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I think I smell lunch.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: But I think, I don't know if I want to burn my song already.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, Grizz, look. I'm really good at building things, so naturally I know how to survive better.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: You did make the best lean-to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did, I did, in the Boy Scouts.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We went to juvie together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We did. Good times. Can I try?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, we'll say you let (laughs) you let him lead for a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you start heading northwest, as you begin to pass the south part of the Ravenroost mountain pass, you're led into a relatively thick patch of very, very painful bramble thicket chunk.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Underbrush is the best!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm beginning to regret rescinding my offer to be the leader!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Everyone knows-- goblins know that the most painful path is usually the right path!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And the most painful path does manage to deal two points of damage to all of you as across your flesh being dragged through the bramble thicket.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's only your own self-loathing, Grizz, Jesus! Ow!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I could use a writing utensil.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Oh, that hurts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Until eventually Snizzler decides to rise up in frustration and take over the leader position.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jeez, all right, come on. Let me see.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Here, take dick bone, that is the leader staff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, thank you. We got it from an old badger.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make your survival check.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I swear this is best.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no. That's not a good reaction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled a natural one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And they were never seen or heard from again. Game over!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well done!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We're running the best goblin scenario ever right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are they going to make it out of the brush?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like brownies and willow, man, we're done for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wading deeper and deeper into the bramble thicket, now under the guidance of Snizzler.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, it's just about finding the flow.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: The flow is up my buttocks!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all take an additional one point of piercing damage as you're scratching your way through.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: It hurt! Guys, guys, I don't know, but I think I have one more rash that I didn't have previously somewhere.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, jeez, there's poison oak everywhere!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, during this travel the rain that is washing down the side of the mountain does lead you to a position of the thicket that isn't quite so heavy, and eventually you guys make your way outside of the immediate physical danger of the terrain.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Congratulations.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's got to be some cover around here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we're further than we started.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: See, at least we're not at the cave anymore.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Piglet doesn't like lightning. Can we go somewhere where there's no lightning?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Well, are we close to a tree? Because trees are really good to have cover under lightning, I'm told.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I wasn't sure whether or not you were the smartest, but that's the best logic I've heard all day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree! I agree! You kill it every time, Grizz!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: That's why I'm the wizard! (singing) That's why they call me the greatest!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You always did read the most.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: You call you the greatest. No one else calls you that!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Well, Grizznak is the greatest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point, a large bolt of lightning hits a tree maybe about 20 feet off from you, sending sparks flying, the tree bursts into flames and tumbles onto the ground. I need--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit! Did you see that, dude?!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Look! Look! Zarongel smiles upon us! See, he's lit our way!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You said that lightning didn't like trees!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was rad, bro! Oh yeah!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know about these guys...

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So, with no cover and nothing around it I have a feeling maybe we should make a mad dash for either caves or potentially Sandpoint. We're not anywhere close to Sandpoint--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've done a few loops in the area--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We've been looping?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did anybody else want to try and lead this expedition?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did you want to go which way-- no, I know which way! I'm going to go! And I'm going to walk in a direction. Follow me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Mezek.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love family outings.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What am I rolling? I just rolled, what do I add to it?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Survival.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Survival? Where is survival? 19!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Finally.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Don't screw this up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with this, Mezek, for as far as goblin franticness is concerned, manages to medicate himself with various alcohols to a state of concentration, pushes forward deeper into the forest, against your better judgement. But in doing so, stays out from the rainfall, manages to avoid a lot of the lightning storm which is now blowing over the southern portion of the mountain range and leads you guys, over the next couple hours, through a bit of a muddy, sloshy forest terrain towards the outskirts of the actual town.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Is it still night, or is it still--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh no, it's about mid-day now, it's pushing-- you're pushing into, like, the early afternoon at this point. You've lost a few hours on your journey.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There! I only take about two hours of responsibility today, and I'm done! It's someone else's problem now!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I will lead, now that I can see where I'm going!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Hey, let's do the circle thing again! That was fun!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was fun, like a game.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was that fun? Because I've experienced what I thought was fun before, and it was nothing like that!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Most of my fun does not hurt quite so much.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: As they say, "No pain, no gain!"

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I don't like the ones who say that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, guys--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: As they say, "No pain, no shame."

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I think they just like to rhyme.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It surrounds the town of Sandpoint itself and encompasses it. It's a port town that's set on the ocean, and this river surrounds the outskirts of it. So you find the edge. You hit the muddy banks of this river, and looking across you can see now the actual city proper.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm into city burning. That's my favorite.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Especially if they're human cities.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Burning, burning. So, I think because my survival ability is so amazing, I'd like to propose that I try to fashion some sort of flotsam, with Zarongel's guidance, I would like to try to take some flotsam and make some type of floaty-pushy thing, that we might wade the wiver-- wade the river.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: "Wade the wiver"?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Not even bothering to look for a bridge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know we don't use no dirty human-made contraptions.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, wait, wait, why don't we just swim?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, no, no, look: the Snizz can do a lot of things. The Snizz does not swim. Not very confident in my swimming abilities.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I'm not sure the Snizz can do a lot of things! (thunder)

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Oh, Zarongel smiles on us again, yay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys glance from the flash--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Smite another tree, Zarongel! Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's okay. You see the bolt of lightning strike a distant watchtower on the far side of the city that has a rod specifically to pull these types of things out of the way.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Stupid idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing over, I'll have you guys roll a perception check if you could. Everybody go ahead and roll perception.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Solid 17.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Marisha?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Al right, so as you guys are glancing about, you can see the city before you and it generally loses most interest to all of you, especially Mezek, who, while your direction sense has been great today, once you get to the actual location of your intent, you've lost all interest and you're playing in the mud. The thick clay on the side of the river smeared on your face.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I want to kick any sculptures that he makes out of mud.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Make sure it's mud!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Whatcha going to do about it, Mezek, whatcha going to do about it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait 'til you're asleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now you're not sure if it was mud because it spooked you a little. So, the two of you glance over and you can see there are two bridges that lead to the city itself that go over, but both of them look extremely heavily guarded. You have two passes of three sets of guards that walk back and forth, armed with crossbows. You guys do-- As the midday rain is still pouring down and it's causing the surface of the river to spatter, you can see there's a little bit of what would have been a morning marine fog that's been burning off since it went out there so it's no longer really at your disposal. However, you two do notice, right across the river against the bank before it rises up to the top of the city itself, you see, barely visible, the outside of a metal grate. Some sort of a subterranean sewer or tunnel system that is sealed shut across the way. It's a good, say, 80 to 100 feet across that river right now and it does have quite the current to it, probably because the rain's been pouring for most of the morning.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Goblins plus sewers equals awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Smart one here, doing the math.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yes. So we have to wade the river in order to get to the grate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you want to do to get there? It's up to you guys.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do we have to go to the grate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have to.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't like lightning, and I really want to use my hammer. As a result. Those two things are connected, don't question.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Can you swim with your hammer?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I just want to smash the dudes guarding the bridge.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Are there guards on both bridges? Are there guards on both bridges?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Look, I think, just putting it out there, that grate is really, really good because there's no people in there. And humans are dumb-dumbs.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are you not goblins?! Do you not like smashing humans' skulls?!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I like, pewpewpew human's skulls. I don't like to get in all up in the face thing, Piglet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think he's a coward!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: How dare you call Grizznak the Great a coward! And I want to-- I don't have magic mouth-- I want to Grease her. I want to cover her in grease.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Who doesn't?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This got weird quick. All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I roll to not get greased?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: We dive in the brambles and then begin to grease each other.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has started. The game has indeed started.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: "I will show you true power!" As grease spurts out from my hand.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I will roll against grease.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, for you, I need you to make a reflex saving throw. So go ahead and roll a d20 and add your reflex.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 19, I will have you know. Plus my reflex.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a little box right there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You rolled a 19?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 19 plus five.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Yeah, she rolled a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go and (raspberry noise) begin to spew grease from the outside of your goblin staff-- Piglet, however, a little ball of anger and muscular rage, instead darts out of the way, slamming into the side of the sandbank that you are currently playing in the mud and clay with, causing that to collapse partially onto you. You are now partially buried under the clay. And what little bit of your head is pointing out is now being sprayed with grease.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sputters, coughs)

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: High five! All is forgiven.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I say we do the opposite of whatever he wants to do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So we're going to get the humans! We're going to smash 'em with hammers and other sharp--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're supposed to be stealthy, can we do it and be stealthy?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I think stealth is better.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there a way to smash humans with stealth?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: How many guards are there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking, there's about six to each bridge that you can see.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I tell if it's more advantageous for any reason to go through the bridge versus the sewer?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Combat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a d20.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is not going to go well!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Roll for comedy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: One!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural one. What?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ten. Ten altogether.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know them pretty well. And they're tall, but they're pretty weak. There's a lot of them on these bridges. That's a lot of really, really weak things. Conversely, in the sewer, who knows what's in there? There's filth, there's scavenging pieces, and possibly dirty humans. So it's up to you. Do you want to go out in a delightful goblin blaze of glory? Or do you want to go out in a delightfully messy goblin blaze of glory?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Right! Let's drown rather than be stabbed!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How are we going to cross?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Drowning is the way Zarongel would want us to go out.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I thought you were going to build us some flotsam-floaty-flotsam.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm really nervous about water. I like burning things.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can carry you, I'm strong.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to look around and see if there's anything to add to this flotsam pile.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, make a survival check.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Can Snizzler and Mezek help me to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Build a rough raft.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yeah, to build a rough raft.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I roll as well.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Do you want to tinker? I think this is survival.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, survival. Ten. But he rolled pretty good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, it takes you guys the better part of about 30 minutes or so as you find things in the nearby edge of the woods. You start pulling up the bits of clay and sand that you were buried under as something caught your foot, and it was a bit pointy but you found a chunk of driftwood that looks to have made its way there. I would like you all to make a stealth check, as you are now having to dart in and out of the forest to find material.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 18 plus 14.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Three plus 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus 20?! Goblins! Oh my god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 36. Damn!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! You guys deftly, running back and forth along the bank of river, grabbing what you can out of the sand and the dirt, apparently entirely unnoticed as there even is a series of guards that come by, four of them, that just walk on past. One of them you swear stared into the forest right at you and went--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Be garden gnomes you guys, garden gnomes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hey, Steven! Did you leave some gnomes out here? Stupid gnomes." And they keep on walking past.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Haha, garden gnome act gets 'em every time! Heh, heh, heh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "From the mold. Stupid garden gnomes." And he keeps going.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: He's the first one that's going to get pew-pewed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree. Boom-boom! Heh.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Boom-boom, pew-pew.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Two arms, two legs, one head, we'll find him at the end.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I've got his face. I've got his beady face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you've crafted this "raft". It's less of a raft and more of a pool noodle buoy thing.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yes! Yes, let's all get on a pool noodle which is basically a giant branch.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: That's the first smart thing you've said all day!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is less like Tom Hanks in Castaway, more Gollum in the river. You guys are having to hold on and move across. However, as you push it into the water, it is buoyant and it does seem to carry you. The current does tend to push it, so you guys are going to have to guide it across the current. If I could have you all make a swim check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I'm so bad at this! I'm really not the best swimmer, you guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh boy, this is so bad!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Four. I have a fear of swimming.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Sorry, 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, okay. So you guys are pushing along. The three of you are back to back, feels like goblin power, getting in there.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Oh, I swallowed a fish! (cough)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Share! Share!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance over your shoulder and see the two of them going, (yelling).

lines.name: IVAN, MARISHA
lines.text: (yelling)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hate water!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Our fearless leaders!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That feels perfectly appropriate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As part of the screaming echoes out, you hear someone in the distance go, "D'you hear that?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shut up! Shut up!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: (screams quietly)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (hyperventilates quietly)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys stop moving and the current carries you, and you slowly begin to rotate in the water and you're being rained on in the face. And you see a couple guards look as you drift under the bridge on the far left side of where you entered and they look down and go, "Man, they'll "throw away anything these days. Perfectly good piece of wood." As it drifts under the bridge, you guys have a moment to go ahead and try and push to shore. Go ahead and roll swim checks again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so afraid.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Negative one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Haha! It's okay.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: What, are you made of lead?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a negative four swim, I just want to point that out. (cries)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you're pushing there, you're making headway, except for the fact that Snizzler is going like, (yelling) and pushing your heads under, trying to climb out of the water.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Stop it! Stop! Stop it!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I say we kill her. We cut our losses? What? Am I right?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Let's just knock her out, we'll need someone to carry all of her stuff.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can carry it! I'm strong!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the splashing and chaos hits, you guys (impact noise) hit the sandbank on the other side of the river. You have managed to cross it primarily.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Snizzler vomits. As soon as he hits land (vomit noises).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to go through the vomit to see if there's anything interesting in there.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I was going to say I'm-- I fight to get to the vomit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah we'll fight, we'll fight.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We'll fight for the vomit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I want both of you guys to roll initiative to see who gets to the vomit first.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's-- oh. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you get?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I got 11!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys both--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Conk!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (cackling) (raspberry noise)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with that, Mezek grabs a hand scoop up of this crusted sand--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a jug.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Puts it in the jug. Closes it off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll go through it later.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Being a goblin is amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point you hear another voice say, "Did you hear laughing? I'm going to go check." And you hear a number of footsteps coming your way.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm going to cast Ghost Sound.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: To see if I can distract them away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What kind of sound are you producing?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm going to produce a righteous merriment-making sound.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the direction of...?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: It sounds like drunken storytelling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, at this point you guys watch as Grizznak spins around, points his staff forward, and quite a ways away you hear this boisterous (indistinct drunk storytelling) start blasting from the opposite side of the bridge, up near the rocks that begin to meet the base of the city's foundation. The footsteps shift and you hear them going across the wood planks above you on the bridge, in the direction that he set. Now is your time to go ahead and dart for the grate on the outside of the sewer. Go ahead and roll stealth checks, all you guys.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Stealth checks?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's leaning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jesus! You vanish from time and space!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He folds to be one-dimensional.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a fifth-dimensional goblin on your team now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys, darting through the rain, using the edge of the rocky--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: What took you so long?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get to the grate, and there is indeed Browntooth sitting there picking his teeth with one of his blades.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How did he do that?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What I don't-- you were just-- and then--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Sometimes it pays to be quiet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think we all learned a valuable lesson.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Now who's going to rip off this grate?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Me!!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Oh, god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll and add your strength modifier.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughing) 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25! With one hand, Piglet, holding the hammer in one hand, grabs the grate, spins it in place, sending rust and metal sparks, and throws it behind her, (sploosh).

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And I go like this.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Again, I would like to mention about the being quiet part.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I take a moment to absorb all of that amazing that happened right there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're welcome, you're welcome.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yeah, Grizznak, not being the strongest of the bunch, is easily swayed by intense feats of strength. Oh, my!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Grizznak, you look like you want to grease her again in a whole new way!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Wishes he had another Grease spell prepared! Woo! Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point you hear the howl of distant wind and the droplets of condensation within the depths of this sewage system beckoning to you as an entry portal to this city. Secretly, privately, and hopefully to wherever this festival is happening where you can gather this "Storm Rock."

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Smells just like home.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Yes, moldy and clammy.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yay. Hey, do you remember when we were in juvie and they threw us down in the "lock box"? For like a month?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, dude, and we got so blazed.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We got so blazed!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was so good, man.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yeah, this reminds me of that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, I agree.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Remember when I ripped the grate off of the thing?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Oh, those were the days.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When did that happen? I don't remember that.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I think we're all going to want to sneak--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Let's go inside.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Sneak around inside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to keep my eyes peeled for things that might be useful or that can contain alcohol.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Good to know. You guys step your way inside the sewer. The slick stone structure of it has lots of residue buildup from various minerals that have come through, as well as various degrees of wastewater that have found their way to the river. The smell is horrible for anyone but you guys. It's a familiar scent. As you make your way inside-- I'd say about 100 feet in as you're going through the darkness here-- but you guys can see fine in the dark, this is goblin speciality.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Darkvision, guys.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I check to see if there are any insects that are tasty-looking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Glancing about, you do see a cluster of some sort of an egg sac that is pushed up into the corner along the curved rotation of this duct. It's roughly the size of a large melon. And it twitches--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I will burn it with Flare.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Don't burn it, we're going to eat it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're looking up at it, (fwoosh) it bursts into flames.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What the heck!!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Who burns food?!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Roasted spiders are best spiders. See, you guys aren't smart, so you don't know that burning spiders makes them that much tastier.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are there spiders left to eat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go and glance and the slight tiny series of squeaks you hear as the hundreds of tiny spider young have burned to their end. There is a nice waft of cooked scent that hits your nose. And the rumbling in your tummy takes over, as you guys all leap in at once, grabbing small chunks of what you can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is the best, when it's crispy on the outside but gooey on the inside.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I wish there was tartar sauce.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Smear some on his spider chunk.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Close enough!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Did you season our birds spider egglettes with vomit?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Don't knock it. This is the good shit.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I burned it for you!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I won it fair and square!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Particularly, "Grizznak the Greatest was here," is what I'm going to mark. But it really looks like a giant butt with like a cloud--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about to say, can you read and write?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: No words?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: No, no words. The symbol for "Grizznak the Greatest" is a goblin with two cheeky farts and a cloud coming out of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: That is the mark of Grizznak the Great.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: A goblin dick looks like a human dick, but with spurs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, god! Oh! Thank you, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We learned a very valuable lesson this evening.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Of goblin physiology.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: That's how you know it's love.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tumblr, get on that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, god. Too late. Moving on.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I can't unsee it in my mind!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You won't have to, you'll go on the internet in about an hour, and it'll be there. There's nothing that can be done anymore.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did this, Phil. You did this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're not kidding. We're not even kidding a little.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Oh, all right. Grizznak the Great has left his Arcane Mark. A goblin dick-butt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Progressing forward for the next couple hundred feet into this slick sewer, making your way along embankments where bits of clutter, broken sticks, chunks of wayward stone and mortar pieces that have washed down here have built these small half-walls of junk that have mucked up the side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Snizzler takes a firecracker that he has and secretly lights it and throws it behind him real fast without telling anybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys walk forward until (explosion) you all glance over your shoulder real fast--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll an attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: "I attack the darkness!" (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I forgot he's a goblin monk. He punches things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, you turn this piece of mildewed, slimy, sewage-encrusted stone to dust as it (poof) in front of you. Holding your fist as it shakes there quivering, your eyes open. Any buzz you may have carried from your morning alcohol has waned for now and you are far more awake and conscious-- with a mild headache.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The path does split here now and divides to the right and left.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I roll perception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To see...?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If there's anything different about them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go for it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 17 plus four is 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Piglet, you're the instinctual tracker. Most goblins hunt with traps, you hunt with teeth.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you get down and (sniffing) begin getting into the muck and pushing it aside. Less than a visual perspective here, you can smell that the bulk of the waste that comes through here comes from the left path. That probably means more waste, means more people.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: More waste, more people.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: So we should go away from the people...

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, what are we doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, why are we here?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Get the blue stone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A rock! The rock!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The cracked man with the blue stone!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Zachary! That's the guy, right?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: He's in blue. He's got a rock.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I remember he's in a birch. Like a birch tree. Right? Birch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, a church tree!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: A church tree, that's right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we stay under trees when there's lightning. That's what you're thinking of.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Right. That's right, because Zarongel likes to smite trees.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Do we go to the poop, or away from the poop?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: To the poop!!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: To the poop! So we go down the left channel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys-- (laughs) you charge forward here--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, just to clarify, because I used my teeth, does that mean I ate poop to find the tunnel?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Well, I hope you saved some for the rest of us!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you had to smear it on your teeth a little. Pushing forward, you guys travel another 80 or so feet before you come onto a large series of waterfalls that run into a central open cesspool area that is down below this path. The actual path diverts and goes around this central tunnel before it continues in a singular direction as the water is pouring in.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: What do we see above?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Can I look as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (splash noise)

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: 25 feet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Those are not supposed to be solid.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: And deep too. What? No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance up and you can see there is some sort of a large, heavy grating that most of the water is pouring down from. You're not quite-- looks like a lot of the rainwater runoff from the city itself. However, you do notice a glimmer from what little bit of light that is bouncing through from the surface and your goblin eyes catch this little glimmer in the corner and you glance over and instinctually run towards it. You go ahead and take a look.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: It's shiny.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find a hefty well-made human shortsword.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Dibs.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So it's a broadsword for you.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Are you saying I'm small?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm saying we're all small.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Oh, right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll? What was the total on your perception check again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. You take this and the blade is perfectly clean. This place is filthy. This blade is perfectly clean, and as you glance over underneath the waterfall you see another glimmer.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Ooh! I run and go over there. I carry the sword with me. I don't trust these two.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I see that he is. I'm approaching cautiously.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I want to push everyone else away and get there first.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Hey wait, you can't even see it, can you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys make initiative checks right now.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, you got plus six.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh wait. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you see this and you glance over out of the corner of your eye, you see Piglet. Her eyes go wide and both of you have that immediate knowledge of "me first". You both dart off around two different sides of this cistern and starting to get there. However, Piglet, you get there first and immediately leap towards this shiny. And the shiny is bigger than you expected.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Can I cast Mage Hand to see if I can snatch it from all three of them or away from the two of them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is it a five-pound maximum?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Five pounds, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go ahead and cast Mage Hand towards that shiny and pull and (grunts) it's a little heavier than you can pull. You get there and you grab on to it. What you notice as you get there is a set, a full set, of a breastplate armor. Human size, giant breastplate with some shoulder pauldrons and a human ribcage on the inside of this breastplate.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ooh! Ribcage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You smell it. Marrow hasn't been tapped yet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I eat it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I eat it.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Barbeque.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I wear the armor? Is it too big for me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty big, yeah. You could sleep in it.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Rent it out!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Overall, the bone is perfectly clean. The armor itself is spotless, looks like it's been perfectly polished.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This marrow's real good. You guys are missing out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pass me a rib.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Is there any of the armor that any of us can fit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could try and pull scrap from it if you wanted to try and scavenge pieces of the metal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we pulled the two shoulder pieces off, could we maybe tie them together and wear them like an Eat at Joe's sign?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Could certainly try that if you want to, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to give it a roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I will say for this-- you know what, go ahead and make a survival check on this to try and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's funny. No, I'm down. 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. You manage to (grunt) for a minute, with some help from a couple other of the goblins, pull one of the pauldrons off. You take it and--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Don't choke yourself!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Based on your combat aesthetic, it's not going to be much of a help to you.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: This is-- I never thought I would hear a goblin character say this, but I can spellcraft to check to see if it's magical at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. The armor?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: The armor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Go for it.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I almost want to kick it into the cistern to get it dirty. I'm sorry. I don't know why I rolled because I'm doing spellcraft. Yes, that's right. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just completely polished down here in the middle of a dank sewer.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Does the armor help any of the rest of us? The goblin-crafted?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to throw it at Piglet. Just throw it at you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's delightful decoration.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh! Ho ho ho ho!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Are you Woody Woodpecker now? I think something killed--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: We've got to get out of here! Before it comes back!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I don't want whatever cleaned this armor to clean off Grizznak the Great's fine robes.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: It'll take the farts right out of you.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Is there any way to climb up to the grate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about 40 feet up from you guys. The path continues across the cistern deeper into the city.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We didn't think about having to crawl back out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beyond the cistern, the tunnel continues after it converges.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Just keep going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's leading this expedition now?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I think I'm more qualified to lead but I don't like to be in front.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have the prettiest hat.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Piglet. I nominate you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hooray!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Piglet, go ahead and roll perception.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) I forget where my perception is every time. There it is. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19, okay. All righty, so as you go-- as you put your new shiny hat on and begin stepping forward across where the paths converge. You-- big, knees forward, stomping steps and you put your head forward and stop as there's a distortion in the air before you. And you breathe out, "huh?" and it (wobbling noise) quivers.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Step aside, step aside! Grizznak the Great is here.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Great. Let's get ready to be hit by lightning.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Well. It looks like something wobbly, so it's probably magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make a perception check.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm going to percept the shit out of this

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: "Probably magic."

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: "Probably magic." 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. You pull her aside. There's nothing visible in the air before you. You're wondering why she stopped, and as you step forward, you hit something. At which point you guys watch as you suddenly notice there is a large cube-like creature made of some quivering gelatinous material. As Grizznak is slowly being pulled into it.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone roll initiative.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Guys guys guys!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's how we do it. You did very well in that. Add your initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, you found a waterbed! Aw, how cool, man! Oh! Gelatinous cube!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Can I get my hands together? At all? Or are my hands--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try here. We'll see how this works out for you. All right, so initiative rolls here. Oh man. All right, all right. So initiative orders, we have 20 to 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you get?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Grizznak is the best.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grizznak, what did you roll?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's how long. That's how long it took. Are you happy now? Are you happy?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs) Oh! Oh no! I'm worried for dick-butt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See! If you will it, it will happen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It will happen, every time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Haven't you heard of the story of the little boy with the magical paintbrush?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you watch Grizznak sucked into this giant creature, you see it shifting and (squelching sounds). Top of the round is Browntooth. Browntooth, what do you want to do on your turn?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Suppose I have to attack it.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Pull me out! Pull me out!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Can I attack him or can I kill it? All right, I hit it with my cleaver.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go ahead and roll for attack.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: 16. Do I add anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, 16 plus--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Yes. 16 plus ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you move up there. You can move five feet and do your second attack if you want to. You're close enough that you can attack with both.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Oh great. Two.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Plus one.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Plus one, three. And do I do another one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, and then you have to do it for the other hand, which is different, so you have to roll again to hit for the second one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what's the damage on the first one?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three damage. All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then that's plus--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Five plus? Plus eight. 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 does hit. It has a very low armor class because it is a giant cube, so go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you cut each time you can see it leaves a giant opening and you cut a wedge out that (slurping noise) slops onto the ground and turns into a slowly liquefying piece of water. The section that you cut out begins to slowly reform but, however, it does lose the mass that you cut of it. So it appears to be having some sort of impact. That finishes your turn, Browntooth. Mezek, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. I'm going to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, actually real fast. 'Cause this is part of the fun of it. Nope, actually, you're good. You're up, Mezek. Sorry, keeping track of the rules for the creature. I haven't used gelatinous cube in so long.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I was waiting to hear, "And Grizznak, you were eaten." (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically, you were.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (screams)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Here he goes again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And hit it with a stunning fist

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and roll for the attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He named it himself.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: And your eyes are lovely.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One of them's mine. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits. Go ahead and roll damage for the fist.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Don't stun the goblin inside, please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then they have to make a fortitude save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What is the save DC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This cube is unaffected by your tiny goblin--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It does go wobble, wobble, wobble.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: You can see me as I'm shifting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So I'd say you moved into there. You going to stay where you are?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take a step back and pull out my quarterstaff. Now that I've had my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you step back. It does get an attack of opportunity as you move back. Its giant pseudopod shoots out towards you.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: It wants to stunning fist you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a 12. What's your armor class?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Touch AC? Or armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, this is a general one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome, that ends your turn. Piglet, what do you want to do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I want to rage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grabbing your oversized goblin skull-breaker hammer, go ahead and roll your attack.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I've always wanted to hear a goblin say that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh okay, so it was 20. Plus seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 plus seven. That hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Where's a d10? Am I crazy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you need a d10? Here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, Grizznak, I need you to roll a constitution save. Sorry, a constitution base saving throw, fortitude save.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So this is a d10 plus four. Oh, that's a pretty one. Eight plus four. Times three? Is that what that is, or?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no. It should say, your second attack down, is during raging.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Okay. Oh, okay. So it's eight plus six then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, there you go. 14 points of damage as your hammer comes down. Wham! Hitting it, stopping an inch from the edge of Grizznak's face as he turns and watches from inside. The whole thing shakes from the impact.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I also get to bite because I'm raging?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Ew. Lucky you.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I have so many feelings right now. Some of them are wobbling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. That hits again. Go ahead and roll for your bite damage. As you go in and bite a chunk out of this giant gelatinous mass like it's dessert.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so roll a d6 and divide by two.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Boop. So it's a three.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so that would be two. Two plus?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Plus three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Two plus three. So you do five points of damage. Giant goblin maw bites into the side, once again near Grizznak's face.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: She's raging. She doesn't know where she is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull a bit away, immediately as you pull back, the rage is in you, you don't really notice the fact that your mouth has gone tingling and you've lost all sensation in your mouth.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey Piglet! How's the jello monster?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Delicious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Your tongue and mouth aren't moving like they should. You're a goblin that got out of the dentist right now, because you took a bite out of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The novocaine cube.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Novocaine cube. That's awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grizznak, did you roll your fortitude save?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Fortitude save. 11?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11. Okay.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Question mark?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you are currently paralyzed for eight rounds.

lines.name: MARISHA, ASHLEY
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Being engulfed by this entity, it's actually caused all of your muscles to lock up. And you feel that same tingling sensation as you glance over and all the little hairs that might be protruding on your body dissolve. And part of your skin begins to peel away.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I still have the last look that I had, which is this stupid face of awe and wonder of Piglet raging. And that's all that's on my face right now as I'm paralyzed inside of the cube.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so finishing Piglet's turn, that comes to you, Snizzler. What are you going to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does he have any limbs or anything that are sticking out still that are accessible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. No. He is fully engulfed by the entity right now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where am I on the map?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are right there. By the way, this is the opening. This drops down about 20 feet and the water is pouring into that, right behind you. So be careful where you're stepping.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's good to know. Okay. Snizzler runs up, takes out a pipe bomb. (clicking noise) Can I shove the pipe bomb in the jello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, if you want to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it going to start sucking me in when I do that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (shushes) Go with it. Go with it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You want to go with it? So you take a step forward, you--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to find the hole Piglet made and aim for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you're going to step into there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And (grunts). Explosive bomb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you watch as this haphazard piece of metal shrapnel that's been matted together with pig feces and twine, goes (sticking noise). And is now right in front of you as you see a little fuse going (sizzling).

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I can't scream because I'm paralyzed, but inside, I'm screaming. I'm screaming very loudly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I look at Grizz and I go--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you going to stay right there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I take a few steps back. Not into the hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll put you there. As you do that and pull back, another giant pseudopod goes (whoosh) out towards you and slams into the stone next to you, but you go, huh. That's the least of your worries, right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on one second, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull back, there's an explosion sound as it bursts inside the cube. So I want you to go ahead and roll for an attack on this. Just for the purposes of this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, Grizz. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, so yeah. This is a direct hit on the creature. So go ahead and do your firebomb damage to the cube.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Oh, how much damage is it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten plus three plus another d4--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: That's what you call--

lines.name: PHIL, TALIESIN
lines.text: --a salt with a deadly weapon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So 15 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 points of fire damage as it bursts on the inside. You are paralyzed, cannot make a reflex saving throw, you take six points of fire damage from being in the blast radius of this thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to say, I do want to do an explosive bomb, so direct hits catch fire, dealing an additional 1d6 fire damage every round.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh. Good to know. So the actual cube is also on fire. Due to the blast radius-- Because of the size of your explosion too, because it is the ten-foot, I need both of you guys to roll reflex saving throws, if you could.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think it's a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, d20, and add your reflex save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16. It's half damage, right, for that, so both of you take three points of fire damage, as the blast radius of this sends chunks of this creature sticking to the ceiling and slopping down.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I have evasion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take none because you're a rogue.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Have I at least been blown out of the cube or am I still inside of the cube?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're like partially out of it, right now, with the blast radius. But--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So slightly exposed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Closing around you slowly. All right, that finishes your turn. Now it is your turn. You take two points of acid damage as it begins to slowly digest you from the inside.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So guys, I will probably not last another couple of rounds. Just to be clear, so.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Working on it.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: The skin is starting, but beyond just the burning, oh god, the burning, there is-- you can see as most of Grizznak's robes have been dissolved into nothingness, and part of his goblin face is starting to peel off, revealing my immensely beautiful crooked teeth. So, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If my parents taught me anything, it's that a burning sensation is nothing to worry about. You're good, you're good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you two are there right in front of it, the thing begins reforming the front of it, which is currently blown open from the bomb that Snizzler left in there. It begins to shift and slither towards both of you guys and intending to engulf you as well. I need you both to go ahead and make reflex saving throws.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh man.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No! I got seven. Do I get to know what the result would be before I use my song?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: You just get to reroll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know what the result is, but do you want to use your song now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that adding your reflex?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I had a seven. Yeah, adding my reflex.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Adding your reflex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you get? Browntooth?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I got a 19 plus nine. 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you dart out of the way into the groove here as it moves forward.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Which is what I was planning to do anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you duck, as it begins to shift forward, Piglet, in a moment of intensity, staring into the face of this for the first time, probably your entire life, you're like, I can die. What? What are you going to do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I decide, no, I'm going to live forever, and I'll sing my song.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, go for it. What's your song?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to try a thing. I don't know if it's going to work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to try to sing my song to the tune of Kiss from a Rose. Because that's my go-to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're my favorite. Oh god.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's see. (sings) Piglet, twitchy scratch the rash until she sees them loud. Love trash, lift the hammer down and crash. Piglet angry time to smash. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well done. So go ahead and reroll your reflex.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Please post those lyrics at some point.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I got a two again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I am going to die.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I mean, it wasn't a very good song.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck you, Seal. Fuck you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No! Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The creature has now engulfed both Piglet and you get pulled up right next to it, jammed into the currently paralyzed Grizznak. I need you to go ahead and make a fortitude saving throw.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh my. Okay. It's the 20?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Here. Go nuts. That's the serious business die.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There we go.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is beautiful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. That's the angry die.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's the goddammit die.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Goddammit, don't die.

lines.name: MATT
