lines.text: And as you're pulled into it, trying to find your way through, you get pulled into the thing, and you feel like that same numb sensation all across. Which, by the way, your goblin song maybe missed a few vowels because of the blahlah, but the rest of your body begins to tingle and you begin to fight against it and your body won't move.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your body's paralyzed for six rounds.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Only six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jammed up against-- However, it does take another d6 points of fire damage from your bomb. So go ahead and roll that if you could.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four points of fire damage. All righty. All right, that brings us back to the top, Browntooth, you're up. You dodge to the side. You see it engulf--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Is it moving away from me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is. It moved this way and you sidestep and it's moving parallel to you.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Okay. I would like to get behind it and shoot my crossbow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you move--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Because I've decided I don't want any more hand-to-hand combat. Seems like a bad idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A pseudopod swings out towards you but you-- it misses you entirely. As you dart backward with your crossbow loaded, you take aim and go ahead and fire.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: This one, right? Fuck. Seven plus nine. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys can see the creature's shaking and shimmering as it's moving forward. It's having a hard time keeping its form together, it's looking really rough as it's slowly dissolving your two friends.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Burn! Fire!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that's going to go ahead and bring us to Mezek.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am going to charge it with my quarterstaff and hit it with a flurry of blows. I don't have any Ki points right now, do I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No because you are sober-- You require a full round action to do flurry of bros. (laughs)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fury of bros? (laughs)

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Fury of bros, (screams) yeah dude!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, so I can't make a movement.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are two squares away from it, so in order to get into it you would have to do a full round action.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'll take the-- I'll take a nice big, flying swing with my stick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (goblin screech) That's 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 hits, go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: God damn. That's seven. Seven points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven points of damage-- How do you want to do this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to, screaming bloody murder, squish it and splash it with the stick like you were trying to hit a rat scurrying around on the ground, and I don't care, once it's gone, I'm going to keep hitting them. I'm going to keep slapping and slapping until it's mush.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably the shiny things you saw earlier, the person that once wore it, bits of them are floating inside. As it begins to collapse on itself like an order of cold flan and as it liquefies, part of it pouring into the cistern, the two of their bodies are starting to be pulled into the cistern with its form, unable to keep shape.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Help! Help! Help!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I run in and grab them!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I help as well. Oh, Grizz!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys grab them, pull them out onto the side. The last bit of the flaming corpse of this cube sloshes into the cistern. You wait about another minute or so before you both get your bodies back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take a little goo out of his ear and I-- Ah, yeah, it's got a little kick there, yeah, you're right.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I take my nose and go-- and I watch as goo goes (wet noise) out of my ears.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is this what being greased feels like? Because I don't like it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not easy--

lines.name: ASHLEY, PHIL, TALIESIN
lines.text: Being greased.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you're resting up from this, do you guys need to do anything to heal up a bit?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: If we had things in which to heal up with, but as of course--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we get any healing surges or anything like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. This is Pathfinder, girl.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: This is not like fourth edition. I don't think we have anything because I certainly didn't take it and we have no real--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have the healing skill, can we try and use the healing skill to reset things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure I'll let you do that, being the monk that you are.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: When they say it couldn't hurt, I'm not sure they're right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20? And with that, with the various burn wounds on your body, from the acid that's burned away and parts of the actual burn damage you've taken from the explosion, Mezek rushes in and like the roughest masseuse you've ever seen--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: It's like the best shiatsu massage I've ever gotten.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let go! Let go! You're holding a lot of tension!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Ugh, that's good, that one right there. That knot especially.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Don't forget to breathe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say for that, go ahead and heal four points due to the rhythmic massage of Mezek's rough and tumble goblin hands.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I would like to point out that you just healed me through a goblin shiatsu massage, that was amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, yep that happened.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With vomit-based massage oil! It's organic!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Only the finest for you.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I step up and I crack my back a little bit and okay. We're good to go. Let's do this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do any of my flasks or jugs have any liquor in them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. However, make a perception check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I also have a jug, I don't know what's in it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. You have a jug, it's mainly sloshing water and grime, your usual-- what you like to sip on the way of your journey. Whatever you find along the way. You guys are into this whole scavenging thing. As you're thinking about this, ah, you didn't bring any alcohol, you smell alcohol.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sniffs) Happy juice. Happy juice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of a sudden you guys watch as Mezek darts down the path--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Follow him! He found booze, which means when there's booze there's stuff and a happy Mezek.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you dart ahead, you come to the edge, and you can see there the path continues for another 200 feet before it dips off, but you don't know quite where. But the scent is strong here and you look over and you can see the wall to your immediate right actually has a fissure in it. A part of it has cracked or a part of it has semi-eroded away. And you can see the very distant dark glimmer of something beyond it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I stick my hand in and go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a strength check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not funny. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eight. You go and grab the stone, you lift your whole goblin body up on it and start pulling. You guys catch up and see Mezek fighting with this wall and making no headway whatsoever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Piglet! Piglet!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, let me smash this with the hammer.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I was going to say, I'm going to grab Mezek's waist and help him pull, so that we're just two goblins pulling on it now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Okay, so you guys are just like double-pulling on it. You make a strength check as well. Go ahead and roll an attack against the wall.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is Mezek getting in a fight with a wall again?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: He does this, just humor him.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: He usually loses.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 17? Is this plus strength?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Plus strength modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, go ahead and roll damage because you hit the wall. Outside of a critical fail, you're fine.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So should I do my normal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, a normal d10 plus-- you're not raging, so that would be a plus four.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing around you, first off you immediately notice that there is a heavy smell of alcohol in this room.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We're in one of those, humans call them a "Ta-vern" or one--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is one of those cel-lar. Cel-lar?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: It's, yeah, it's where they do their fighting at. It's basically where humans go to beat up each other. It's a goblin pit!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sounds like heaven.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: It's amazing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Whatever that means.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Baby chickens?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (loudly) There are chickens here?! It's like a "hoo-er house", right?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Do they eat owls, too? Chickens and owls? I'm getting hungry!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Baby owls!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which, as you guys are getting hungry, you look around this chamber you're in, you see a sack of moldy grains, small containers of salts and spices, dried meats that are put on racks against the wall, casks and bottles of wine, and ale all throughout this--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Done. Ale? Done. Going for the ale.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We forgot about our mission for as long as it takes for us to eat everything in this cellar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys go nuts! Devouring everything, grabbing at meat, filling your bellies. You'd be welcome to fill your jugs with alcohol--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm filling my flask and my waterskin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you clear out your jug first, or are you just going to add to it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm just going to add it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, cool.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Does this help me at all with my current hit point situation?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eat up, maybe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the circumstances here, you heal one hit point from the food--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We all heal one?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: But yeah, I will eat it all, if anything it will allow me to feel better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to go for it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe you have to have a chat with a spirit animal.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm a god damn goblin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing bad happens when you eat moldy grain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get on top of that moldy grain, you tear into it, you destroy it--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm going to-- at one point I'm going to take one of the pots and I'm going to scoop it, and I'm going to pour it over my head because I know that moldy grain has healing properties. And as I put it into my mouth I'm going to rub it all over my burning sores.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm imagining Orson Welles at the end of Apocalypse Now! right now, with the towel--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Also Arcane Mark on the cellar wall, Goblin Dickbutt, Grizznak the Great has been here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you go ahead and focus over on the wall, you hear this rumbling in your stomach. Go ahead and roll a fortitude saving throw.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yeah, I'm really good at fortitude saves, why can't I do will saves, ever? Fortitude saves... shit.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: (cackles) Literally.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the good news is you heal three additional hit points as your goblin metabolism takes in the horrible, moldy grain. The downside is, you then vomit up all the moldy grain, and you lose the hit points.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to get rid of the wine and put that all in my jug.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I feel great until I vomit it back up again.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I had all the wine in my jug, and I got rid of it and filled it with vomit.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I'd like to secretly pocket some of the dried meats. To take with me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Secretly, so nobody else sees it, or--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: No, they don't see it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a sleight-of-hand check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like a man with secrets. Oh my--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He just shoved an entire cow down his pants.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He rolled a-- tell him what you rolled.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I rolled a natural 20 with a plus 12 sleight-of-hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) As everyone else is marveling themselves at this display of goblin gluttony, you step backwards and somehow in the process of giving your fellow goblins a little bit of a head nod, you have managed to fill all of your pouches and pockets with every single piece of meat on that wall. It goes from full to empty in a second, and no one's the wiser. You got like saddle bags filled with food right now and no one seems to have noticed.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Browntooth! You're looking very fit.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Well, I work out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're very curvy.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So curvy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you've got a little junk in the trunk, looks good.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Yeah, y'know. Comes from my mother's side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, sure, yeah. Your mom, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are finishing this mountain of goblin gluttony, we're going to go ahead and take a quick break here, we'll be back here in a few minutes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't let me forget, I want to try and find some wine bottles for molotov cocktails, don't let me forget.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. So. We've had a little break here, we're coming back into the chaos here. So, this goblin band, having taken root in this storage basement beneath this human barn, the center of the town of Sandpoint, you've--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, wait, I want to make sure I find some wine bottles, maybe I can make some molotov cocktails real quick. Maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You gather a couple of bottles of wine. You, not really being able to read the labels, gather what seems to be alcoholic and functional.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Looks expensive.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Looks like molotov.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. While this is happening, does anyone want to do anything else here?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I want to roll in the discarded grain that I then threw up to give me temporary hit points, and I want to roll in it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You roll around in it and you feel like it'll give you sufficient protection against a light wind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like a dog rolling in his vomit.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yes, exactly. That's exactly how it's going down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can hear the footsteps and what sounds like voices from upstairs. There is a ladder in the far edge of this room that leads up to a trap door, and when the trap door is closed, you can hear what sounds like the occasional chuckle, voices that are muffled through the wood. It appears that there is an actual tavern above you on street level that has a handful of patrons in it.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So, do we escape through the tavern or do we go back into the caves and see if we can get under the godly poopoo place?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I roll a perception to see if there's any other way out apart from the place with all the humans and the place we just came from?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's not great. It's a ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten. I mean, there's the path. You can keep going or there's the tavern.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh right, we can keep going.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We can keep going to find the birch tree.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Church.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Which is where the-- Church, right, the birch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which as a note, you guys currently have no idea where in this city you are. You're just in the sewers.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Don't even worry about it. Or we could just run out into the streets. Goblins.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: That sounds decidedly unstealthy. I say we keep going down until we find poop that seems like it's from a blue man.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like that. Yeah. For the blue poop.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Browntooth, let's go find the blue poop.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's find the blue poop. Onward.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So we're going to crawl back out through the hole that we made.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe there's more cellars like this too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: More food.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys climb outside of the section of the broken wall and continue down the path.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: As we leave, I would like to leave a parting Flare into the cellar, because burning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) Okay.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Because burning. As I leave, I'm like-- on my way out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You see the flare begin to slowly cause an ember to burn at the edge of a burlap sack of some spices in the corner.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good one.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yeah! Woo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you stumble a ways ahead before you find out that there, that drop-off that you noticed, you come up to it and it is indeed a drop-off. You glance down and the walkway you're at ends abruptly around a large cylindrical cistern-type chamber. Probably a good 80 feet across and about 80 feet down, further than your vision can really see. You don't see a bottom of it. You see (water falling).

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: What does the loogie tell me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You spit out the loogie. Make a perception check.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Loogie perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're all rolling terrible tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get so caught up with the flow of the loogie that you keep leaning forward further and further trying to figure it out as your heels lift up.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Woo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys watch as Grizznak suddenly tips forward and goes over the edge.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, he's dead.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Is anyone going to catch me? Because I'm going to sing my song.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can try to catch you. What would that be? Or would it be acrobatics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be a straight up, I would say, dexterity. Go ahead and roll a dexterity check on this one to see if you can be fast enough to grab.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll join her in it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll join. We'll make goblin--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: This is the last time I save your ass.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Goblin chain. We're going to goblin chain this. Everyone loop together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, you're not helping. You're watching.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Straight dexterity? 20, total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20, okay. Piglet reaches forward and goes over, too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh god. My hubris.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As they both begin to tumble over the edge, you grab and you both slip forward. The three of you manage to grab the back of Piglet and pull her up and slowly, you guys get back up into the tunnel. No, no, no. Piglet managed to grab the very back of Grizznak and pull him back up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn, guys. We're badasses, just like we practiced. Good work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grizznak, you're really frustrated because you swear you were this close to seeing when that thing would drop before you got pulled up.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Guys, what's the big deal? I was almost there. I almost saw it. Oh, hi.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: No more saving you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have an alternate plan. What if I throw one of you across to the other side?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Hmm. I have another alternate alternate plan. I look to see if there is any way to climb up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Math is killing me. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance upon the sides of the stonework on the inside of this giant cylindrical cistern that leads up to the where all the water's pouring in from. Glancing about, there are very, very sparsely set stones that are slightly more protruding than the rest. You gather they could be leapt from stone to stone, if one is so interested in being a good climber. So there is a way, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Goblin toss. That other thing, that sounds way boring. Goblin toss. Boring.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I volunteer as tribute!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah! You want me to toss you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I tie the rope to my waist and I tie the rope to her.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: All the way across?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All the way across.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have 50 feet of rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mezek ties the rope around. Who gets the other end of the rope?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Give it to Piglet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Piglet, you have one side of the rope now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to start swinging him around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Because there isn't a lot of-- Roll a strength check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I approve of this plan on every level.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. So you swing him around once before you realize that, because you're up against a wall there's not a whole lot of space and (impact) into the stonework. You take one point of bludgeoning damage, hitting the side as he slips down and then is now dangling and you can pull him back up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. Toss--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a big gap in Mezek's grin as a tooth is now missing from that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It looks good. It suits you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was hurting already.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: More space to eat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. Strawholder. All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right. Well, that's all my plans.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: You're not going to throw him across?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh wait. I could toss him across. Is there something on the other side? Did I make that up? Is there more path?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking across the way, you can see there is another opening, 80 feet across.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shall I try to toss him?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I only have 50 feet of rope. That would have gone poorly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you still volunteer as tribute?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I volunteer.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You volunteer?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I have a plan. It only works for me though, but fuck you guys.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, I'm going to toss you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, first I take out a bottle and I drink it. And I shrink. I take my Reduce Person vial.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Extract. Okay. What is normal-sized Snizzler shrinks down to about half the size now. Voice is higher, appearance is ridiculous. You guys now all can't help but chuckle at this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Are you ready to throw me? Let's try this.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're so dumb.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are you guys laughing at? What? Don't-- (garble)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're small. You're comparatively smaller to us now.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I take her little tiny arms and I start making her dance like a little doll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Stop it.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: My name's Snizzler. Snizzler, Snizzler, Snizzler. I like to fly. I like to fly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mom! Mom!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Snizzler, you immediately regret this decision.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm going to, just for shits and giggles, I'm going to also cast Breeze.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A natural 20?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 23 all together.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's the Golden Snitch, man. Don't fuck with the Golden Snitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take this tiny goblin, lick your grimy finger, feel the wind, point Sir Ruth style and shotput. Snizzler arcs forward, much farther than you expected. Overward, you see in the distance-- rope not attached, by the way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys, it's beautiful from up here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over. It comes up and you can see, you may or may not be close enough to the ledge, oh god, it's right there before you. Go ahead and make an acrobatics check in the middle of the air to try and maneuver yourself in the air to catch--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on, wait. She rolled the Golden Snitch. Let me roll my golden. Not, not--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about to say, that Golden Snitch never rolls well, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It never rolls well. Wait, this is just a dexterity?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Acrobatics.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no. Wait, is it song time? Is it song time?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Song time. Sing your song.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? Am I falling now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can sing your song and go for a reroll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess it's song time. As I'm still soaring, in my tiny voice, I say (sing) Snizzler, zazzlers, sizzler, zaz. Eyebrows this goblin once had. My bombs go boom, they never miss. Hi Homeland Security, because now I'm on the watchlist.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's funny because it's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. Yes, it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and reroll that acrobatics check.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Don't use that die.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll use this one.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Got to get better. Got to get--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did it get worse? What is with the rerolling?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, Piglet. You had this. This isn't your fault. Stupid bomb goblin can't catch a ledge. But you like, you cross your arms and look around, just so everyone else understands that it wasn't you.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Good try, Piglet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (splashing) Into the water below.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hate water.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: She really does.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey. He didn't die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I do need you to make a swim check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Well, I rolled a 14 and I have a minus four, to my swim. So ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're treading water and slowly making your way across this giant cistern, about 20 feet below where they are. You get halfway across, splashing. You guys see Snizzler trying to make her way over to where you guys are.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: (laughing) There's water down there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seriously, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll another swim check to try and make it the other half of the way.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Come on, Snizzler.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's better. 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. You make your way up to the edge, like (grunting). You guys can look down now and you can just barely see outside of your darkvision here, you see Snizzler approach and is now treading water at the bottom of the cistern below you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We'll lower the ropes, Snizz.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on. Can I see if I can find purchase on a little rock? Off to the side, I can hold onto.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You go over and reach over and you grab a rock and pull onto it and pull your weight up and your fingers slip off of it. There is a slick liquid from general grime.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Grab the rope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on! Come on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I drop the rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The rope (thumps) into the water next to you. You grab onto it and the rest of you guys slowly pull Snizzler back up onto the entranceway.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: My turn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to look at the ceiling. I want to see if there is anywhere we can attach the rope to the ceiling to make a swing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, it is a dome, a smooth stone dome that then has three openings where the rainwater is pouring into currently and filling the bottom of the cistern.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So the only way up is basically those little stones? That we can see.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: The only other thing I can think of, taking my Snizzler hat off for a sec-- er, my Grizznak-- is I could potentially Mage Hand up the rope. But I don't think I can tie it, I can just move it up.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: You know what? No, I'll climb up and tie the rope. And everyone else can climb.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We'll catch you if you fall.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Right. That'll happen. I climb up to the grate, with the rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and roll a climb check.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: 12 plus climb. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. As you pull yourself up (grunting) and it is a slight curvature, so you're, like, hanging and holding onto it, but in true goblin Tom Cruise fashion, keeping a stern expression on your face.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: That's why he's so small.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Makes sense. Hopping on the sofa.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: (goblin noise) I'm in love. I'm in love. I'm in love.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull yourself up, tiny goblin feet dangling below, keeping your focus, Browntooth, you bring your way across the ceiling, carrying that rope in your grin. You get up to the edge of where the water's currently pouring into the cistern and it's moving past, I need you to roll another climb check to try and keep holding.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're starting to slip.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Can I cast Open on the grate and see if it'll maybe lift him up with it open?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You know what, for a--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Do you want me to grab it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Let's see if we can. What's the spell? This is Open?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Open.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He transcends space and time and climbed a slippery wall with a rope in his mouth.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Almost climbed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The rest of us are total degenerates.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm just throwing people, like--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's no resistance to it. As you're slipping, slipping, all of a sudden the grate that contains the water opens and actually slams into your side, but you manage to catch onto it. It knocks the wind out of you, but you manage to hold on the edge. You catch your breath and you realize this is, first off, holding your weight, and second, there's a number of cross iron bars that are all welded together that would be a good place probably to tie the rope off.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I think I will tie the rope to the things that would make a good place to tie the rope.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: You're welcome!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: One left.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Two birds for you and one bird for me. Smash it, twist it, turn it in a stew. Stick it in your face and you love-- and I love you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love that song.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: He's got many songs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The other goblin crew has already made it, they've got the stone, they're back. That's what's already happened in my head. I'll be disappointed if that's not what happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In climbing up the side of the grate, however, going on the other side, you are now fighting against the torrent of water so I need each of you to make a climb check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh we're all doing this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have to, you can stay back in the sewers.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Wait for the fire to come.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Three? MATT; (laughing) What do you have, Grizznak?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: MATT Two? Okay. So--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Who do we have to save now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say for the sake of brevity here, an additional hour or so is spent perpetually retrieving your allies who keep getting all the way up and then (splash) right into the water. But you have to admire the tenacity.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I drink everything in my flask at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you get your Ki point going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got to keep drinking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually you guys make your way up past the flowing of water, which has slowed now, and that's probably how you're able to do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Someone upstairs finally jiggled the toilet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You make your way up into an upper sewage system, and you guys crawl through what is a much smaller series of pipes, to the point where you as goblins still have to crawl to make your way through. The sludge is thicker here and what little bit of rain is pouring through you manage to keep between your arms and legs. Eventually you find your way into the bottom of some sort of a chamber that is filled with apparently human waste.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The blue poop has to be here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take the poop and I start making a ball out of it and I light it to see how flammable it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: This is totally logical.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: If it were church people, they drink a lot, so it should light up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like the finest of candles, it does catch fire and begins to burn slowly. It's not dry enough to catch-- we're having this conversation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm really excited that this is a thing that's happening right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would need to be suitably dried out to work as proper fuel, but--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Definitely lots of alcohol, lots of drugs, yeah. I start packaging up some of the poop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I look for any sort of egress.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Same.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why not, I'll do it too.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. While you're collecting your filthy prize, both Piglet and Grizznek, you guys look up and notice that there is a wooden or stone ceiling, but a singular opening above you. Like a circular hole.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: First, I would like to listen to see if there's any stinky, stupid humans upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: (singing) Stinky stupid humans. Eight.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I love that game. Stinky stupid humans!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: They're so dumb. Stinky stupid humans, but they're fun-- to kill!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You listen and you hear the muffled noises of conversation as well. It sounds like there are a few different voices, though they're behind a couple of walls from where you are.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So they're not straight above us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm going to cast Open again on that opening.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the spell is a success!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yes! I will climb up through the poop chute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull yourself up out of it, in a wonderful medieval version of the Ghoulies VHS cover, you pull yourself out from--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow, we went back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh man, I couldn't go near toilets for years because of that movie cover at the VHS store.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I stick my head up and I look through the toilet seat and then I go (blows nose) and knock a huge chunk of poop out of my nostril.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Glancing ahead, your Open spell missed, but did hit the front of the outhouse which has currently swung open in the mid-day, facing the window leading into the tavern that you guys nearly entered beforehand.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Oh. Close.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Closes shut. However, it does appear to be nestled in an alleyway on the outside of it. It's a very thin opening. You didn't see any people actually in the alley. You saw the outside of a window and a street thoroughfare.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Mmm.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Where are we?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We're outside now. We seem to be in what the humans use to get rid of all their precious waste.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're inside an outhouse?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: That sounds sort of oxymoronic.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We're in one of those redundant human cubes in which humans go to poop inside of instead of doing it where they sleep, which is way more practical.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, guys, those church things-- isn't there like a symbol that people use, like a circle or like--?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Well, I say we get Browntooth up here and he can go scout it out. Right, Browntooth?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: If it keeps you from blowing things up, and you setting anything on fire. Right, I climb up and go out the outhouse to stealthily move into the street.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So, as you--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Wait, wait, wait. I'm also going to cast Penumbra on him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: So, Penumbra, it basically puts a permanent shadow on him.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll a stealth check, if you could.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Makes it so that even light spells make him still look like he's covered in shadow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some drinks being served, a guard at the door on the inside. However, looking to your left, there the alleyway spills out into a main street thoroughfare, and you can see people walking by, families with children. There's a general air of jovial energy to it, and some people are wearing flower crowns on their heads. You can see carts being put along the street. Seems like the festival you were told of, this terrible, human festival seems to be in full swing. Go ahead and make a survival check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You probably have another hour of sunlight. So you don't know how much longer this festival's going to be going. You spent quite a while getting here and wandering the sewers.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: As per typical goblin fashion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed. However, you notice that everyone is walking a certain direction. And, one, there are a number of carts that are going by. There are currently unmanned, closed carts that would be used to sell fruit and fish. This being a port town, fish is a big export here. And the alleyways that you came out of? There is a second alleyway that offshoots from where the outhouse is that goes between the buildings off the main thoroughfare. This is what you're able to gauge in your time out here.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I go back and tell them what I've seen. So everybody's going that way.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We should probably go--

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: That way?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: That way.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That way!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe if we get on each others' shoulders with a coat, we'll look like peoples!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Balding hair, a double chin, leaned forward on the bar, looking like he's ready to pass out from the amount of alcohol he's been drinking. He is in the inside of the tavern. He has a very long coat that drapes past the bar.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We got to do it! There's no alternative!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: There is an alternative! There's the little alleyway!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How many patrons are there? Do I get to know from my perception check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing in there, you see probably ten patrons altogether.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look around. Do I see anything that looks like a children's clothing store? Maybe two of us can be a child and three of us can be an adult.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: If each one of us is a leg, and we're three goblins tall, that's six feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, yeah, no, you're right, Grizz.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Look for a cow costume. Perception check for a cow costume.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'll cast Penumbra on you, so at least you'll be in shadow.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And then I could stealth. Well, your stealth is insane, actually. He has +20 stealth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got very high stealth, too, so I'm going to come in with this.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You guys should go in and get the coat! I'll go in, too!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to sneak in to get the coat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll stand guard and watch outside the window.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I still have my Penumbra, right?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Penumbra.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not have Penumbra because he cast it on her, right? Or is it a once at a time thing, or can you do multiple people?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: That's a good question. Shit. It's in the Ultimate Magic book.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say, for the time being, it affects both of you. It's fine. Using the shadows around you, it's getting late. The angle of the sun, shadows are not too hard to find. Roll stealth checks, all three of you, as you make your way along the side, darting between barrels and trying to find a way into the tavern from the window, other than the front door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look in and there is one person manning the kitchen. You see this poor, older woman, who is in the process of running around with four things burning and is like, "There's too many! I hate festivals! Coming!" She's not paying attention to the door right now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So we could stealth by her, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could try.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Or we could kill her.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Look, I know I'm a goblin and I love human blood, but she looks like she's trying her best, you know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She seems largely distracted. You guys, with your current stealth, not an issue. You make your way through the kitchen unnoticed. You make your way into the tavern proper. You can see a handful of patrons around a table playing cards, talking to each other. You hear a couple of them. One person's like, "Stupid tradition. I'm just going to stay here and drink until I care." Takes a big old sip. Somebody on the other side of the table goes, "Speeches every year, speeches! Father "Zantas has shown that religion has no sense of brevity!" You see this other guy at the far end table gets up, "And what about you, Zed?" And slaps the shoulder of the guy who has the large coat on. He's leaning forward and goes, "At least the meals were good. I'm probably going to skip "out on the consecration. I've no stomach for prayer these days." He's face down on the bar right there. "Oh, Zed! That'll be me in an hour." He goes and sits down at the table. There's just the barkeep at the bar who's close. Everyone else is at the table now at the card game and Zed is passed out at the bar. What are you going to do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Guys, what was the name of that dude we were supposed to find?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Something with a 'Z,' with two parts. It's not him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's not him?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: He's not wearing blue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he's not wearing blue. He's wearing a dark, muddy brown color.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's steal his coat!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll stealth again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cannot roll perception for NPCs today at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys dart under one table, wait for a moment, the barmaid walks by, dart under another table. You're chaining your way across this room between these men. Eventually, finding your way right to the outside of this passed-out Zed whose arm drifts and hangs loosely to his side. His body is half against the bar and is a good two minutes from slumping directly onto the ground and off his stool.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How do we steal it?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Should we wait for him to slump?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The barkeep is like, "You okay, Zed?" Pokes him a little bit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (heavy sigh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's all right." Goes back to cleaning a mug.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe one of us should distract the barkeep while the other two grab the coat. Make noise in the corner or something.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We're still outside, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're just waiting.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I keep casting Open and Close on the outhouse door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (creaking) (slamming)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does Zed have anything on his person other than a coat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can only see the coat on him right now because it's a long trench coat.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: We'll throw something to the other side of the bar.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Break some glasses. Really distract them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you throw?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to grab one of my goblin jag stars and I'm going to pop one of the bottles on the shelf. I assume there's a shelf of bottles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a shelf of bottles.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to pop one on the opposite side of us to try and knock it over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mezek, you pull out your goblin jag star, which is essentially the equivalent of a shuriken, but it's carved out of pieces of odd, rusted metal that had been tied together. It's more of a cluster of broken whatever you found from a wagon wheel that was busted weeks ago, but you throw it as a ranged weapon. Roll an attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. A bottle shatters and sprays across the back of the barkeep who's like, "Hey, what the "hell is that?!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grab it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He seems currently distracted. The three of you together make sleight of hand checks right now as you rush up to try and pull this off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where's sleight of hand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is probably me, sorry.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Should be under sense motive.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't have it.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I have it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys aren't trained in it, so this is going to be a basic roll, adding your dexterity modifier.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So 11, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you're all above a ten with two high rolls, that's good. You all leap up real fast, grab his coat, and pull it off of him before anyone seems to notice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to see if he's got anything on his belt like a pouch or anything like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance, and there is a belt pouch there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to make a stab at grabbing and ripping it off.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Don't get greedy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll another sleight of hand check.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We're goblins; of course be greedy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What am I rolling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is another sleight of hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15. Okay! You snatch it and all of a sudden you hear a voice from the front door go, "Hey, "what's that? I saw something! Is someone trying to steal from Zed?!" You hear footsteps as somebody begins walking over to where he was right now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Go! We run?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys run? Make stealth checks, guys.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We have the coat, though, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have the coat with you, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It happens to be the table where the card game was being played. All the cards go (crashing), all the coins scatter in the air. The guys go, "Whoa what the hell is that?!" And they see as this coat scampers off into the kitchen on its own. You guys hear voices go, "Did you see that?!" "It went in "the kitchen, come on!" You hear the sound of chairs scooting as all of a sudden people are beginning to stand up and rush towards the kitchen after you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: While we're running, I'm going to take my jar of puke and pour it out on the ground behind us like a mud slick.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have puke, too!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're holding the knot on your head, you pull the jar, pour it out, and spill this slick mass of goblin vomit and whatever else liquid you put inside there. As you dart through the kitchen, the cook goes, "Your food's ready! What the--?!" And sees you guys dart out the door as the crowd comes in and two of them (yell) and fall on their backs immediately there. A third man steps over and follows you into the alleyway. The cook's like, "You can't be in here! What are you doing?!" As the door slams, you guys make your way into the alley. You see the three of them rush out holding the coat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so glad I planned for this. And I go, go guys. Smoke bomb!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the door opens again, you see this breastplate-adorned guard of the city who is essentially the bouncer of this place, rushes out, blade drawn, helmet half-cocked on his face where it doesn't fit right and one eye looks higher than the other, and he goes, "You!" (explosion) As smoke fills this entire alleyway, he begins coughing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before the cloud gets too thick, I go-- and run.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We should go in the outhouse and assemble our Mary Kate and Ashley situation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, let's do it!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: We should probably not do it in the outhouse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can run all the way around the alleyway from this. Let's get down the alley.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys rush out of the alleyway, you get out of the fog, you manage to dart off to the side and wait a little bit. You hear that guard wander off and start shouting, and vanishes in the distance. After a few moments of waiting, you're pretty certain he hasn't been able to keep up with your trail because you're

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah! Who wants to be the head?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: That's the important one.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: We all have goblin heads.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I have a 17 charisma.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't like talking to people.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Whoever has the highest charisma should definitely be the head.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Grizznak the Great will be the head!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the best goblin Voltron ever!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Hello, fellow human! Aren't you having a wonderful human day today?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: You guys have the high strength.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we've got the high dex. You should be the middle, so we'll be the legs.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: You form the torso. I will form the head and together we shall be Goblon!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've been doing a lot of crunches, so I feel pretty good about being the core.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's in the pouch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the pouch you find eight gold pieces, a small snuff box.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ooh! I eat all the snuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: You're flying!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did you eat?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a will saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where's my will saving throw? There it is. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16. Okay. The world gets a little funny for a bit, and you feel exhilarated, though a little unfocused. What normally is the goblin ADHD is now in hyperdrive. You're looking everywhere. We have Grizznak as the head.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Grizznak forms the head!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: We are the middle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are the middle.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: We're the legs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, you stand up, coat goes on, snapping it shut.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I give Grizznak my pretty hat.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Okay. I actually have a goblin's wizard's hat.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can you put it on top to humor me?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Why don't you put it under one of our arms so it looks like we're carrying a helmet?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right. Fair enough.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'll probably get away more with the wizard hat.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Oh, you think?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, where are you guys going?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: We're going towards where the people were going. Was the alleyway parallel to the main street?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was, yeah. You follow that.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Head down the alleyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great. The sky has cleared, by the way.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Like Vincent D'onofrio.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, like Men in Black.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so! (laughs) I'm so happy right now.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Hello!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Morning!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You come to the end of the alleyway into an open town square, a main open thoroughfare with large tents that are erected, with large carts, people barking for food, different carnival games set up throughout this area. What you notice amongst the buildings and houses is a large stone cathedral that looms over this entire area. In front of this cathedral, there is a raised platform where the band is playing, where the music's coming from. People all around this area are now talking and families laughing. There are small poles that are erected that are covered in flower wreaths that are hung around it.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Sounds gay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, quite happy and jovial.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Never been so disgusted in my entire life. I poke my legs and my torso to move them forward so that we can get closer to the stone. Does it look like there's a speech that's going to be starting soon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: People are gathered towards the center of this area around that.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I would like to motion my torso and my legs to be on the outer edge of the front couple of lines of the group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Look and see if there's anybody wearing blue.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, look for the blue poop.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Blue. I see silver. I see brown, which is nice. I see red. I see--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What about blue? I don't care about the other colors!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I see purple. You mean yellow?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No! Blue!

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Look for the guy in the blue!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I see a blue sky!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this is happening, a drunk man, 30-something, a red chin-strap beard, and long hair pulled into a top knot has a tankard in front of him and, (hiccup) "Hey, happy Autumn's-thing."

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Happy Autumn's-thing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a bluff check.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Oh, I'm so good at bluff. 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, "I think you need some more of this than I do."

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yeah, I do!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He pats you on the back with a hefty arm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Since you are the guys that are holding the legs right now, I need you to both make strength checks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five. One leg, whoa, goes forward, and you stumble and take a knee like you're kneeling in the middle of the street. And the man who holds the drink goes--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Kids, I want to talk to you about safe sex.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I am reflecting upon the glory that is this most holy day--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Stop talking!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, you're one of them church types. Never mind." And the guy stumbles off. At this point, you see the crowd starting to hush a little and gather towards--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hup!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get back up. Make a perception check if you could, Grizznak.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Okay, that was very close. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. Glancing up, you can see now--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I try not to put my little hand up. I put it back down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The people that are gathering towards this central platform area you can see a person ascending the steps on the side. What you see is a man dressed in simple, but elegant blue robes that walks from the cathedral, who is standing now at a podium in the center of this. As people begin to hush, some yell towards him. He has short brown hair and a well-kept beard that show a social station amongst the townspeople, although his demeanor is very humble. But some people are paying attention to him, some people are looking around, some people are still yelling and playing games. He seems to be a little frustrated that no one's paying attention.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Blue alert! Blue alert! We have a code blue!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Running towards it.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Does he have a stone?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Can I see the stone at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not see a stone. However, as you guys begin to make your way through the crowd, and everyone's paying attention to various things in the area, he reaches into the pocket of his robe and pulls out a small cast iron pellet about that large. And he takes it, looks around, and throws it to the top of this platform. As it hits the woodwork, you hear a sudden (thunderclap). It causes this echo of thunder throughout the entirety of this area and everyone stops and goes (gasp).

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: He's got a boom cube.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's got a boom-boom rock.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is that the rock we want?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: No, it's not the rock, but I like that rock.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: That's the rock we want!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Guys! You've seen boom-boom rocks. We all know about boom-boom rocks.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Have we seen these before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have not.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Okay, well, Grizznak likes to

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is there a way to confirm whether or not that's the rock that--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, for you, go ahead and roll a wisdom check.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Oh, hohohoho.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: O Grizznak the Barely Alive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You realize at this moment, as you were instructing the goblins that can't possibly be the stone because that's a boom-boom rock, you realize, holy shit, this entire journey was to retrieve a boom-boom rock.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Guys, Guffeye wants us to get boom-boom rocks.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why does she want us to get boom-boom rocks?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Because they're boom-boom rocks!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But we have boom-boom rocks back home!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With this, suddenly, you hear screams. You hear dogs starting to bark in the distance and you see the glow of flames over across the way as two streets, three streets away, you see fire beginning to glow and plumes of smoke build up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fire!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: People begin to run, and chaos breaks in the crowd as people begin looking about, screaming, "What's going on?! We're under attack! Goblins are here!"

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Okay, so Goblon is going to lurch forward, and I'm going to try and see-- does he have like a pouch of boom-boom rocks? Or anything like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, all you see is the single stone rolling off the top of the stage--

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Mage Hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear another explosion in the distance as a section of burning wood flips.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to meet

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Do you think that had anything to do with the fire you set?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I don't think it's the fire that I set in the tavern.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, guys, remember? There's other goblins here.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Remember, it's the Seven-Teeth--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: We've got to get the rock!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Too many tooth! Get the rock.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Wait, I'll ask you. Is anyone watching us?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I think everyone's pretty distracted by the big boom-booms.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here, I can help clear this area out, too. I light another little firecracker and throw it down next to us to scare the crowd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as you throw another firecracker, you guys stumble forward, foot by foot. I want you to make another bluff check. And I want both the legs, both of you guys to make another strength check to try and get there quickly.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Natural 20. That puts me up to 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so: as you're rushing forward you can see the crowd look at you as you turn and be like, "No! Don't go that way! The goblins are that way!" And they're actually genuinely trying to save you.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I will save us from this goblin scum!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as you say that, the firecracker goes off behind. Everyone looks around distracted, as both of your legs tumble forward and you tumble forward. The coat unravels as what was once a single entity rolls into five goblin balls that all (rolling thumps) across the stonework, slamming into the base of this platform. You guys can hear the distant screams of goblins two or three streets over where the main battle's happening. The guards have moved in that direction. This open thoroughfare is mostly empty of all people at this time. You glance over and can see the stone is in the center of a light piece of mud that hasn't fully dried from the earlier storm.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I go to get the stone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's fine with me." I need you all to roll initiative.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Adventuring party.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn adventuring parties.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Look at all this adventure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm at an eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, hold on just a second.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's no fleeing in D&D is there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you can flee.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Oh, watch!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can do anything you like.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: If you've never seen goblins run before--

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: You're going to see some hellacious fleeing right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not above it.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Because there's a lot of them with armor and winged statuary!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They got lots of hair. We've got really big ears, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20? Higher than 20, anybody?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Damn, look at that! All right.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Super runaway!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's Browntooth. You had--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got the rock?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I've got the rock.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Glad that we were able to keep it.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: So far.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These humans look ready and eager, and there's a part of you that's like, "Oh man, it "would feel good to cut them down." It is up to you what you want to do.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: How many of them are there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Four against five. Those are good goblin numbers.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's five of them.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Oh, there's five of them? There's five of us. That's bad goblin numbers. That's very bad goblin numbers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 to 15, anybody?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Ten to 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry, 20 to 15. Nope? All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm all for smashing stuff, but I smashed a wall, I smashed a crate. I'm down to run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 to ten?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: 15 to ten, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. Ten to five?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like the random sounds of sheep being tortured.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sheep bleating)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thursday night. It's a nice Sunday night right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Top of the round. All of them charge into the square as the rest scattered. Bring this in here. Browntooth, you're up first.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: I look for some place to hide and head there as quickly as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Closest place to hide here would be behind this cart or behind the platform.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Where are the attacking people?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're right here.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Ah! There they are. I get behind the platform.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You duck around here. Go ahead and roll a stealth check to hide in the shadows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that your turn?

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Can I see them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see them.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Yes, that's my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Snizzler, it's your turn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: First, I'm going to take a pipe bomb and throw it right at that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to get a little closer to do it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I move up one square and then I hit him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lob it! Roll for an attack.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Goblin pipe bombs!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 hits!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a touch attack, correct?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Touch attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's actually on fire right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone in a ten foot radius must make a reflex save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed. What's the DC on that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a failure, success, success. Three damage, three damage, and six damage. Nice!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus the main dude takes 13 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13 points of damage! Woo!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I use the rest of my movement to also run backwards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Run towards these things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's about as far as you can get right there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You run up, fling it, and dart away, as it lands at the foot of the guy with the blades out, he prepares himself and goes to guard as it (explosion) bursts in front of him. You can see the flames coast up and now the fire is caught into his hair and his armor is burning from whatever goblin liquid, napalm-like material you had in there adhered to him. As the fire bursts outward in a ten foot radius because of your goblin expertise with explosive devices, the flames catch the three other allies of his, who all manage to avoid most of the impact. But you do see them scarred and burned a little bit from the side of the blast. The fighter is furious as the flames lick across his torso. That ends your turn. Piglet, you're up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, you lit them on fire, so now I want to smash them. But maybe I should run away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Follow your heart.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Ranged attack? No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't have a ranged attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are an up-close and angry--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Screw it, I'm going to rage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So I rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where do you want to go?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How up-close and personal can I get? What dude did Marisha just hit real hard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That guy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How close can I get to him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can get right up to him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's get right up to that guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You (yells) rush up, hammer in the air. You get one hammer attack on this turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 just hits! His armor class is 17. Go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is my d10, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, d10.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Seven plus six is 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Angry Piglet's up front. First and foremost, the little halfling bard shouts out to the rest of the group, "Valeros, you okay, bud? All right, let's do this. Great!" And he jumps up onto this cart right here and pulls out his flute and begins singing, "And as their footfalls to the ground, "the strength and mighty muscles bound! They raise their blades into the sky and cut those goblins "nigh and high!" As he begins to sing, he bolsters all his allies in song. You see all of them begin to rally themselves for the battle, hearing their friend accompanying this rousing fight. That finishes his turn. They all have bonuses to their combat prowess.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: That's bullshit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The paladin, who watched her friend get pummeled in the chest and set aflame, goes, "Not "on my watch!" and steps in to you and is going to take a swing with her longsword.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Paladin who worships cliches, apparently.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Would you consider yourself an evil character?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm just trying to get mine, you know what I mean? Probably, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's going to attempt to Smite Evil as her swift action. That's a natural 20. I have to confirm to see if it crits. That is a 17. What's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19, it does not confirm crit! However, you do suffer--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Piglet's going to go down swinging, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's eight points of slashing damage as the blade strikes into you and a burst of divine energy as you feel your dark core of your blackened goblin heart all of a sudden burn with radiant, divine energy. That ends her turn.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: Fucking born agains.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next up, this older wizard dude is going to look to the one who threw the bomb and goes, (casting) and holds aloft his staff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? I don't understand you! Speak English!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You put out your giant goblin ear to listen to the strange language. A pock of greenish energy forms in the air as an arrow streaks towards you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Foul play, man, foul play. Thought you were trying to tell me something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends his turn. The cleric, now, is going to step up to the center, holds her scimitar in one hand and her holy symbol to the sky and goes, "Sarenrae, protect us!" Energy drifts off. All of her allies heal up six hit points.

lines.name: PHIL
lines.text: All right, I'm going to kill her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also heal six hit points because you are a living creature and you're in the radius, so you heal six. Unintended consequence of her circumstance.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Because her god considers you collateral.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Her god's like, "I like this one!"

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I like this one's spunk!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This one's got the moxie!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The fighter who's on fire is going to grin and bear the flames because he wants to take down the one who smashed him with the hammer. He's going to take another 1d6 fire damage; go ahead and roll for that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, he is angrily going to unleash upon you with his longsword and shortsword. That is 13 to hit with his longsword. What's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You duck out of the way. He goes in to stick you with a shortsword. That's an 18.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 19. Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are hard to hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (yelling) I'm going to live forever!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Can't seem to find you with his blades as he angrily swings outward.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: And by forever you mean 30.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grizznak, your turn.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Oh, crap. I think I'm going to give this a shot. I'm going to try to get kitty-corner to where Piglet is, so five feet away, not within threat range of the group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Yeah, one more step towards me. Trying to see if that's going to get Piglet in the way or not. It may. If I have the movement, I'll do one more right next to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you have the movement.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: I'm going to mock the wizard. I'm going to look at him and go, (casting) (sneezes) And cast Flaming Sneeze. (sneezing) As gouts of flames start coming out of my nose over and over again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, go Grizz!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Moldy grain, man. Not even once.

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Moldy grain especially. (sneezes)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm okay with this. What are the rolls you have to make for that one?

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: My DC on it is 13 and I got a ten. Song time!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Song time!

lines.name: IVAN
lines.text: Song time for my reroll in the midst of my sneezing, because I'm not feeling like I'm tickled enough, I launch into my: (sings) Grizznak, Grizznak, the greatest that there is! Smarter than the stupid ones, even when he whizzed. Look at them run, look at them hide, look down to watch them burn and die! Zergamot will loot the corpse and then we'll take a ride, hey! I'm going to reroll. I'm never allowed be a player ever again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Every time we've used our songs to reroll it's gotten worse!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you roll? Are you kidding me?!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no!
